pull.title: test: move check_node_connections to util
pull.body: This function (`check_node_connections`) exists in `feature_anchors.py` and `p2p_add_connections.py` and does the same thing in both, this PR moves this function to util to avoid repetition and facilitate maintenance.

events.body: I think all commits can be squashed into one to allow for easy `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra`.

> I think all commits can be squashed into one to allow for easy `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra`.

Done.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -445,6 +446,14 @@ def set_node_times(nodes, t):
         node.setmocktime(t)
 
 
+def check_node_connections(*, node, num_in, num_out):
+    info = node.getnetworkinfo()
+    if info["connections_in"] != num_in:
+        raise AssertionError("connections_in: %s != %s" % (str(info["connections_in"]), str(num_in)))
+    if info["connections_out"] != num_out:
+        raise AssertionError("connections_out: %s != %s" % (str(info["connections_out"]), str(num_out)))

@@ -445,6 +446,14 @@ def set_node_times(nodes, t):
         node.setmocktime(t)
 
 
+def check_node_connections(*, node, num_in, num_out):
+    info = node.getnetworkinfo()
+    if info["connections_in"] != num_in:
+        raise AssertionError("connections_in: %s != %s" % (str(info["connections_in"]), str(num_in)))
+    if info["connections_out"] != num_out:
+        raise AssertionError("connections_out: %s != %s" % (str(info["connections_out"]), str(num_out)))
comments.body: To get more friendly error messages. It makes easier to indentify if the error happens because in or out connections.

comments.body: assert_equal will already print all needed info, no?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -445,6 +446,14 @@ def set_node_times(nodes, t):
         node.setmocktime(t)
 
 
+def check_node_connections(*, node, num_in, num_out):
+    info = node.getnetworkinfo()
+    if info["connections_in"] != num_in:
+        raise AssertionError("connections_in: %s != %s" % (str(info["connections_in"]), str(num_in)))
+    if info["connections_out"] != num_out:
+        raise AssertionError("connections_out: %s != %s" % (str(info["connections_out"]), str(num_out)))
comments.body: The difference is minimal, example: `AssertionError: connections_in: 5 != 3`, with `assert_equal`: `AssertionError: not(5 == 4)`. I can change back to assert_equal if you think its better, np.

comments.body: python will show the stack trace on uncaught exceptions, which shows that the argument was `connections_in`. So I think there is no difference in practise?
